page.title: 07Recreation and Employment
page.content: Mr Alan Braithwaite took over the shop from Mrs Dent in 1983 and moved it to its present location next to the Travellers Rest public house. This pub was formerly named the Bay Horse - it has been extended and modernised in recent years and now provides good restaurant facilities and attracts customers from a wide area including tourists. Fairfield House (Mrs Dent's house), used to be the Greyhound Inn and still has its cellars. The village hall is well maintained and well supported and in regular use for social gatherings, parties etc. The population has remained at around 120 in spite of the general local tendency of young people 'born and bred' in the village having to move away out of necessity to find work and houses which they can afford.
